intro: Stanleya annua, commonly known as the annual Stanleya, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it is often found in open meadows and along streambanks. Stanleya annua is known for its short life cycle, completing its growth and reproduction within a single growing season.
